title: 2011/268/EU: Council Decision of 2 May 2011 appointing one Bulgarian member of the European Economic and Social Committee
header:
6.5.2011 EN Official Journal of the European Union L 118/8
COUNCIL DECISION
of 2 May 2011
appointing one Bulgarian member of the European Economic and Social Committee
(2011/268/EU)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, and in particular Article 302 thereof,
Having regard to the proposal of the Bulgarian Government,
Having regard to the opinion of the European Commission,
Whereas:
(1) On 13 September 2010, the Council adopted Decision 2010/570/EU, Euratom appointing the members of the European Economic and Social Committee for the period from 21 September 2010 to 20 September 2015 (1).
(2) A member’s seat on the European Economic and Social Committee has become vacant following the end of the term of office of Mr Jeliazko CHRISTOV,
main_body: Mr Ivan KOKALOV, Vice-President of КНСБ (CITUB, Confederation of Independent Trade Unions of Bulgaria), is hereby appointed as a member of the European Economic and Social Committee for the remainder of the current term of office, which is until 20 September 2015.
This Decision shall take effect on the day of its adoption.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 2 May 2011.
For the Council
The President
MARTONYI J.
(1)  OJ L 251, 25.9.2010, p. 8.
